GenAI and the psychology of work

Work is a central source of identity and meaning. The rapid and widespread adoption of generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) is reshaping workplaces, challenging traditional human ‚Äìmachine boundaries and redefining the knowledge, task, and social characteristics of work. GenAI can benefit workers by enhancing their productivity and performance, but it also poses psychological threats to workers' needs for competence, autonomy, and relatedness.

Key Concepts:

  • Generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) is reshaping workplaces.
  • GenAI can demonstrate cognitive, creative, and interpersonal capabilities that challenge traditional human‚Äìmachine boundaries.
  • The rapid adoption of GenAI threatens workers' needs for competence, autonomy, and relatedness.
  • GenAI helps automate repetitive processes, freeing up time for strategic and creative work.
  • GenAI increases worker enjoyment and meaningfulness of work by shifting focus toward social aspects.
  • GenAI satisfies relatedness needs by enhancing social skills and fostering positive emotional experiences.
  • GenAI replaces human interactions, leading to social isolation and erosion of social norms.
  • GenAI integration can increase objectification of workers and dehumanize coworkers.
  • Perceptions of human coworkers are assimilated toward GenAI systems, reducing prosocial motivation.
  • Workers' response to psychological threats and GenAI
GenAI Workplace Productivity Psychology Identity Meaning user experience designers productivity worker enjoyment meaningfulness of work
